data.event: The county was established in 1854 and named after Stephen A. Douglas (1813â€“1861), U.S. Senator from Illinois.

In the Nebraska license plate system, Douglas County was represented by the prefix "1" (as it had the largest number of vehicles registered in the county when the license plate system was established in 1922).
In 2002, the state discontinued the 1922 system in the three most populous counties: Douglas, Sarpy, and Lancaster counties.
Douglas County is governed by a board of seven county commissioners, elected to four year terms.
